member.name: T:Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor
member.summary: Base class for custom document visitors.

remarks.p: With DocumentVisitor you can define and execute custom operations that require enumeration over the document tree.
For example, Aspose.Words uses DocumentVisitor internally for saving Document in various formats and for other operations like finding fields or bookmarks over a fragment of a document.
To use DocumentVisitor:

list.item: Create a class derived from DocumentVisitor.
Override and provide implementations for some or all of the VisitXXX methods to perform some custom operations.
Call Node.Accept on the Node that you want to start the enumeration from.

remarks.p: DocumentVisitor provides default implementations for all of the VisitXXX methods to make it easier to create new document visitors as only the methods required for the particular visitor need to be overridden. It is not necessary to override all of the visitor methods.
For more information see the Visitor design pattern.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor.VisitFieldStart(Aspose.Words.Fields.FieldStart)
member.summary: Called when a field starts in the document.

remarks.p: A field in a Word Word document consists of a field code and field value.
For example, a field that displays a page number can be represented as follows:
[FieldStart]PAGE[FieldSeparator]98[FieldEnd]
The field separator separates field code from field value in the document. Note that some fields have only field code and do not have field separator and field value.
Fields can be nested.

member.param: The FieldStart node that is being visited.
member.returns: A value that specifies how to continue the enumeration.

member.summary: Called when a field separator is encountered in the document.

For more info see

member.param: The FieldSeparator node that is being visited.
member.returns: A value that specifies how to continue the enumeration.

summary.para: The Aspose.Words.Rendering namespace provides classes and enumerations that allow to specify additional options for rendering, printing and converting documents to PDF.
To actually render, print or convert a document use the corresponding methods on the object.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.ComHelper
member.summary: Provides methods for COM clients to load a document into Aspose.Words.

remarks.p: Use the class to load a document from a file or stream into a object in a COM application.

The class provides a default constructor to create a new document and also provides overloaded constructors to load a document from a file or stream. If you are using Aspose.Words from a .NET application, you can use all of the constructors directly, but if you are using Aspose.Words from a COM application, only the default constructor is available.

example.code:
[VBScript]
Dim helper Set helper = CreateObject("Aspose.Words.ComHelper")
Dim doc Set doc = helper.Open(fileName)

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.ComHelper.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.ComHelper.Open(System.String)
member.overloads: Allows a COM application to load a document.
member.summary: Allows a COM application to load a from a file.

remarks.p: This method is same as calling the constructor with a file name parameter.

example.code:
[VBScript]
Dim helper Set helper = CreateObject("Aspose.Words.ComHelper")
Dim doc Set doc = helper.Open(fileName)

member.param: Filename of the document to load.
member.returns: A object that represents a Word document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.ComHelper.Open(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Allows a COM application to load from a stream.

remarks.p: This method is same as calling the constructor with a stream parameter.

member.param: A .NET stream object that contains the document to load.
member.returns: A object that represents a Word document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Node
member.summary: Base class for all nodes of a Word document.

remarks.p: A document is represented as a tree of nodes, similar to DOM or XmlDocument.
For more info see the Composite design pattern.
The class:

list.item: Defines the child node interface.
Defines the interface for visiting nodes.
Provides default cloning capability.
Implements parent node and owner document mechanisms.
Implements access to sibling nodes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the node.

remarks.p: This method serves as a copy constructor for nodes. The cloned node has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original node.
This method always performs a deep copy of the node. The isCloneChildren parameter specifies whether to perform copy all child nodes as well.

member.param: True to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself.
member.returns: The cloned node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on DocumentVisitor.
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if DocumentVisitor stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.GetText
member.summary: Gets the text of this node and of all its children.

remarks.p: The returned string includes all control and special characters as described in .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.GetAncestor(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the first ancestor of the specified object type.
member.param: The object type of the ancestor to retrieve.
member.returns: The ancestor of the specified type or null if no ancestor of this type was found.

remarks.p: The ancestor type matches if it is equal to ancestorType or derived from ancestorType.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.GetAncestor(Aspose.Words.NodeType)
member.summary: Gets the first ancestor of the specified .
member.param: The node type of the ancestor to retrieve.
member.returns: The ancestor of the specified type or null if no ancestor of this type was found.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.Remove
member.summary: Removes itself from the parent.

member.returns: Next node in pre-order order. Null if reached the rootNode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.PreviousPreOrder(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Gets the previous node according to the pre-order tree traversal algorithm.
member.param: The top node (limit) of traversal.
member.returns: Previous node in pre-order order. Null if reached the rootNode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Node.ToTxt
member.summary: Exports the content of the node into a string in plain text format.

remarks.p: This method removes field codes and Microsoft Word control characters, uses CrLf (or any other) combination of characters to mark ends of paragraphs in the resulting string. It produces a different result from which just gets the text from the node without removing field codes or special characters.

member.returns: The content of the node in plain text format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Node.NodeType
member.summary: Gets the type of this node.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Node.ParentNode
member.summary: Gets the immediate parent of this node.

remarks.p: If a node has just been created and not yet added to the tree, or if it has been removed from the tree, the parent is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Node.Document
member.summary: Gets the document to which this node belongs.

remarks.p: The node always belongs to a document even if it has just been created and not yed added to the tree, or if it has been removed from the tree.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Node.PreviousSibling
member.summary: Gets the node immediately preceding this node.

remarks.p: If there is no preceding node, a null is returned.
remarks.note: Calculating the value of this property iterates from the first child node of ParenNode to this node.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Node.NextSibling
member.summary: Gets the node immediately following this node.
member.remarks: If there is no next node, a null is returned.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Node.IsComposite
member.summary: Returns true if this node can contain other nodes.
member.value: This method returns false as Node cannot have child nodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Node.Range
member.summary: Returns a Range object that represents the portion of a document that is contained in this node.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Lists.List
member.summary: Represents formatting of a list.

remarks.p: A list in a Microsoft Word document is a set of list formatting properties. Each list can have up to 9 levels and formatting properties, such as number style, start value, indent, tab position etc are defined separately for each level.
A object always belongs to the collection.
To create a new list, use the Add methods of the collection.
To modify formatting of a list, use objects found in the collection.
To apply or remove list formatting from a paragraph, use .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.List.ListId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the list.

remarks.p: You do not normally need to use this property. But if you use it, you normally do so in conjunction with the method to find a list by its identifier.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.List.Document
member.summary: Gets the owner document.

remarks.p: A list always has a parent document and is valid only in the context of that document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.List.IsMultiLevel
member.summary: Returns true when the list contains 9 levels; false when 1 level.

remarks.p: The lists that you create with Aspose.Words are always multi-level lists and contain 9 levels.
Microsoft Word 2003 and later always create multi-level lists with 9 levels. But in some documents, created with earlier versions of Microsoft Word you might encounter lists that have 1 level only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.List.ListLevels
member.summary: Gets the collection of list levels for this list.

remarks.p: Use this property to access and modify formatting individual to each level of the list.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.List.IsListStyleDefinition
member.summary: Returns true if this list is a definition of a list style.

remarks.p: When this property is true, the property returns the list style that this list defines.
By modifying properties of a list that defines a list style, you modify the properties of the list style.
A list that is a definition of a list style cannot be applied directly to paragraphs to make them numbered.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.List.IsListStyleReference
member.summary: Returns true if this list is a reference to a list style.

remarks.p: Note, modifying properties of a list that is a reference to list style has no effect. The list formatting specified in the list style itself always takes precedence.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Lists.List.Style
member.summary: Gets the list style that this list references or defines.

remarks.p: If this list is not associated with a list style, the property will return null.
A list could be a reference to a list style, in this case will be true.
A list could be a definition of a list style, in this case will be true. Such a list cannot be applied to paragraphs in the document directly.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.FootnoteType
member.summary: Specifies whether this is a footnote or an endnote.

remarks.para: Both footnotes and endnotes are represented by objects by the class. Use to distinguish between footnotes and endnotes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Words.FootnoteType.Footnote
member.summary: The object is a footnote.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.ExportImageSavingEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the and events.

remarks.para: By default, when Aspose.Words saves a document to HTML or Aspose.Pdf XML, it saves each image into a separate file. Aspose.Words uses the document file name and a unique number to generate unique file name for each image found in the document.
allows to redefine how image file names are generated or to completely circumvent saving of images into files by providing your own stream objects.
To apply your own logic for generating image file names use the , and properties.
To save images into streams instead of files, use the property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.ExportImageSavingEventArgs.CurrentShape
member.summary: Gets the object that contains the image that is about to be saved.

remarks.para: Aspose.Words uses the document file name and a unique number to generate unique file name for each image found in the document. You can use the property to generate a "better" file name by examining shape properties such as , and .
Some images in the document can be unavailable. To check image availability use the property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.ExportImageSavingEventArgs.IsImageAvailable
member.summary: Returns true if the current image is available for export.

remarks.para: Some images in the document can be unavailable, for example, because the image is linked and the link does not point to a valid image. In this case Aspose.Words exports an icon with a red cross. This property returns true if the original image is available; returns false if the original image is not available and a "no image" icon will be offered for save.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.ExportImageSavingEventArgs.ImageFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the file name (without path) where the image will be saved to.

remarks.para: This property allows you to redefine how the image file names are generated during export to HTML or Aspose.Pdf XML.

When the event is fired, this property contains the file name that was generated by Aspose.Words. You can change the value of this property to save the image into a different file. Note that file names must be unique.
remarks.p: Aspose.Words automatically generates a unique file name for every embedded image when exporting to HTML format. How the image file name is generated depends on whether you save the document to a file or to a stream.
When saving a document to a file, the generated image file name looks like <document base file name>.<image number>.<extension>.
When saving a document to a stream, the generated image file name looks like Aspose.Words.<document guid>.<image number>.<extension>.
remarks.para: must contain only the file name without the path. Aspose.Words determines the path for saving and the value of the src attribute for writing to HTML using the document file name, the and properties. For Aspose.Pdf XML only is considered.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.ExportImageSavingEventArgs.ImageStream
member.summary: Allows to specify the stream where the image will be saved to.

remarks.para: This property allows you to save images to streams instead of files during export HTML or Aspose.Pdf XML export.
The default value is null. When this property is null, the image will be saved to a file specified in the property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.ExportImageSavingEventArgs.KeepImageStreamOpen
member.summary: Specifies whether Aspose.Words should keep the stream open or close it after saving an image.

remarks.para: Default is false and Aspose.Words will close the stream you provided in the property after writing an image into it. Specify true to keep the stream open.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.TabStopCollection
member.summary: A collection of objects that represent custom tabs for a paragraph or a style.

remarks.p: In Microsoft Word documents, a tab stop can be defined in the properties of a paragraph style or directly in the properties of a paragraph. A style can be based on another style. Therefore, the complete set of tab stops for a given object is a combintation of tab stops defined directly on this object and tab stops inherited from the parent styles.

In Aspose.Words, when you obtain a TabStops collection for a paragraph or a style, it contains only the custom tab stops defined directly for this paragraph or style. The collection does not include tab stops defined in the parent styles or default tab stops.

member.dev: This whole collection is stored in the paragraph attributes as a single attribute.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode
member.summary: Base class for nodes that can contain other nodes.

remarks.p: A document is represented as a tree of nodes, similar to DOM or XmlDocument.
For more info see the Composite design pattern.
The class:

list.item: Provides access to the child nodes.
Implements Composite operations such as insert and remove children.
Provides methods for XPath navigation.

member.dev:
Maintains a pointer to the list of children.
Provides helper methods to insert or remove a whole range of nodes.
Inserting and removing children are the most important features here.
Public API methods for insert and remove verify the arguments well and raise the insert/delete node events to the owner document.
The child nodes are stored in a single linked list and the composite node knows only its last child. This approach was taken from XmlElement. Inserting or removing a node just means updating the NextSibling and ParentNode of the appropriate nodes.
Note that navigating forward via NextSibling is fast, while navigating backward via PreviousSibling is slow because it requires traversal of all children starting from the FirstChild. I presume that users don't need to traverse the document backward too often. Note that due to the same reason InsertAfter is normally faster than InsertBefore.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the node.

remarks.p: This method serves as a copy constructor for nodes. The cloned node has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original node.
This method always performs a deep copy of the node. The isCloneChildren parameter specifies whether to perform copy all child nodes as well.

member.param: True to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself.
member.returns: The cloned node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.GetText
member.summary: Gets the text of this node and of all its children.

remarks.p: The returned string includes all control and special characters as described in .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.GetChildNodes(Aspose.Words.NodeType,System.Boolean)
member.overloads: Returns a collection of child nodes that match the specified type.
member.summary: Returns a live collection of child nodes that match the specified type.

remarks.p: The collection of nodes returned by this method is always live.

A live collection is always in sync with the document. For example, if you selected all sections in a document and enumerate through the collection deleting the sections, the section is removed from the collection immediately when it is removed from the document.

member.param: Specifies the type of nodes to select.
True to select from all child nodes recursively. False to select only among immediate children.
member.returns: A live collection of child nodes of the specified type.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.GetChildNodes(Aspose.Words.NodeType,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a "live" or "snapshot" collection of child node that match the specified type.

remarks.p: Snapshot collections require less resources than live collections because a snapshot collection of nodes is not updated when the document is changed.

Snapshot collections are useful for tasks, that do not require immediate update of the collection when the document is changed. For example, select all shapes and delete them is more efficient using a snapshot collection.

A live collection is always in sync with the document. For example, if you selected all sections in a document and enumerate through the collection deleting the sections, the section is removed from the collection immediately when it is removed from the document.

member.param: Specifies the type of nodes to select.
True to select from all child nodes recursively. False to select only among immediate children.
True to return a live collection; false to return a snapshot collection.
member.returns: A collection of child nodes of the specified type.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.GetChild(Aspose.Words.NodeType,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an Nth child node that matches the specified type.

remarks.p: If index is out of range, a null is returned.

member.param: Specifies the type of the child node.
Zero based index of the child node to select. Negative indexes are also allowed and indicate access from the end, that is -1 means the last node.
True to select from all child nodes recursively. False to select only among immediate children.
member.returns: The child node that matches the criteria or null if no matching node is found.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.SelectNodes(System.String)
member.summary: Selects a list of nodes matching the XPath expression.

remarks.p: Only expressions with element names are supported at the moment. Expressions that use attribute names are not supported.

member.param: The XPath expression.
member.returns: A list of nodes matching the XPath query.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.SelectSingleNode(System.String)
member.summary: Selects the first Node that matches the XPath expression.

remarks.p: Only expressions with element names are supported at the moment. Expressions that use attribute names are not supported.

member.param: The XPath expression.
member.returns: The first Node that matches the XPath query or null if no matching node is found.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Provides support for the for each style iteration over the child nodes of this node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.AppendChild(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Adds the specified node to the end of the list of child nodes for this node.

remarks.p: If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The node to add.
member.returns: The node added.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.PrependChild(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Adds the specified node to the beginning of the list of child nodes for this node.

remarks.p: If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The node to add.
member.returns: The node added.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.InsertAfter(Aspose.Words.Node,Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Inserts the specified node immediately after the specified reference node.

remarks.p: If refChild is null, inserts newChild at the beginning of the list of child nodes.
If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The Node to insert.
The Node that is the reference node. The newNode is placed after the refNode.
member.returns: The inserted node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.InsertBefore(Aspose.Words.Node,Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Inserts the specified node immediately before the specified reference node.

remarks.p: If refChild is null, inserts newChild at the end of the list of child nodes.
remarks.note: InsertBefore could be slower than InsertAfter because it needs to iterate over all nodes from the first child to the reference node.

remarks.p: If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The Node to insert.
The Node that is the reference node. The newChild is placed before this node.
member.returns: The inserted node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.RemoveChild(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Removes the specified child node.

remarks.p: The parent of oldChild is set to null after the node is removed.

member.param: The node to remove.
member.returns: The removed node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.RemoveAllChildren
member.summary: Removes all the child nodes of the current node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.CompositeNode.InsertAfter(Aspose.Words.Node,Aspose.Words.Node,Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Inserts nodes starting from the start node up to, but not including the end node into this node after the reference node.
member.param: Node to start moving from.
Can be null to indicate move all from start to the end.
The nodes will be inserted after this node.

member.summary: Returns the index of the specified child node in the child node array.
member.remarks: Returns -1 if the node is not found in the child nodes.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Markup.SmartTag
member.summary: This element specifies the presence of a smart tag around one or more inline structures (runs, images, fields,etc.) within a paragraph.

remarks.para: Smart tags is a kind of custom XML markup. Smart tags provide a facility for embedding customer-defined semantics into the document via the ability to provide a basic namespace/name for a run or set of runs within a document.
remarks.p: can be a child of a or another node.
The complete list of child nodes that can occur inside a smart tag consists of , , , , , , , , , , , , .

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Markup.SmartTag.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: When you create a new node, you need to specify a document to which the node belongs. A node cannot existing without a document because it depends on the document-wide structures such as lists and styles. Although a node always belongs to a document, a node might or might not be a part of the document tree.
When a node is created, it belongs to a document, but is not yet part of the document tree and is null. To insert a node into the document, use the or methods on the parent node.

member.param: The owner document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Markup.SmartTag.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the node.

remarks.p: This method serves as a copy constructor for nodes. The cloned node has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original node.
This method always performs a deep copy of the node. The isCloneChildren parameter specifies whether to perform copy all child nodes as well.

member.param: True to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself.
member.returns: The cloned node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Markup.SmartTag.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on DocumentVisitor.
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if DocumentVisitor stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.
member.remarks: Calls , then calls for all child nodes of the smart tag and calls at the end.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Footnote
member.summary: Represents a container for text of a footnote or endnote.

remarks.p: The Footnote class is used to represent both footnotes and endnotes in a Word document.
Footnote is an inline-level node and can only be a child of Paragraph.
Footnote can contain Paragraph and Table child nodes.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.InlineStory
member.summary: Base class for inline-level nodes that can contain paragraphs and tables.

remarks.p: InlineStory is a container for block-level nodes and .

The classes that derive from InlineStory are inline-level nodes that can contain their own text (paragraphs and tables). For example, a Comment node contains text of a comment and a Footnote contains text of a footnote.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.Field
member.preliminary: [The properties and methods of this class are subject to change.]
member.summary: Represents a Microsoft Word field.

remarks.p: At the moment objects of this class are only returned by MergeFieldEventArgsBase.Field to allow using DocumentBuilder.MoveToField to move to a merge field quickly in a custom mail merge event handler.
There will be more methods and properties added to the Field class later.

member.dev:
Simple structure to group three model nodes that represent one field.
I actually want to rework the way fields are parsed. At the moment each field has its own regex to parse, this is wrong. Main parsing should be done by this class, see FieldCodeParsing.doc in the docs. It should parse into Expression and Switches and the derived field classes can do further detailed analysis.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.GroupShape
member.summary: Represents a group of shapes in a document.

remarks.p: A is a composite node and can have and nodes as children.
Each defines a new coordinate system for its child shapes. The coordinate system is defined using the and properties.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase
member.summary: Base class for objects in the drawing layer, such as an AutoShape, freeform, OLE object, ActiveX control, or picture.

remarks.p: This is an abstract class. The two derived classes that you can instantiate are and .
A shape is a node in the document tree.
If the shape is a child of a object, then the shape is said to be "top-level". Top-level shapes are measured and positioned in points.

A shape can also occur as a child of a object when several shapes are grouped. Child shapes of a group shape are positioned in the coordinate space and units defined by the and properties of the parent group shape.
A shape can be positioned inline with text or floating. The positioning method is controlled using the property.
When a shape is floating, it is positioned relative to something (e.g the current paragraph, the margin or the page). The relative positioning of the shape is specified using the and properties.
A floating shape be positioned explicitly using the and properties or aligned relative to some other object using the and properties.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the node.

remarks.p: This method serves as a copy constructor for nodes. The cloned node has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original node.
This method always performs a deep copy of the node. The isCloneChildren parameter specifies whether to perform copy all child nodes as well.

member.param: True to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself.
member.returns: The cloned node.

member.summary: A quick way to determine if this shape is positioned inline with text.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.ZOrder
member.summary: Determines the display order of overlapping shapes.

remarks.p: Has effect only for top level shapes.
The default value is 0.
The number represents the stacking precedence. A shape with a higher number will be displayed as if it were overlapping (in "front" of) a shape with a lower number.
The order of overlapping shapes is independent for shapes in the header and in the main text of the document.
The display order of child shapes in a group shape is determined by their order inside the group shape.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ShapeBase.Rotation

remarks.p: Relative file name: ..\\My Documents\\SalesReport.doc.
Bookmark within another document: http://www.aspose.com/Products/Default.aspx#Suites

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Rendering.PdfOptions
member.summary: Allows to specify options when rendering document pages to a PDF file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Rendering.PdfOptions.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep clone of the object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Rendering.PdfOptions.HeadingsOutlineLevels
member.summary: Specifies how many levels of headings (paragraphs formatted with the Heading styles) to include in the the PDF document outline.

remarks.para: Specify 0 for no headings in the outline; specify 1 for one level of headings in the outline and so on.
Default is 0. Valid range is 0 to 9.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Rendering.PdfOptions.ExpandedOutlineLevels
member.summary: Specifies how many levels in the PDF document outline to show expanded when the PDF file is viewed.

remarks.para: Specify 0 and the document outline will be collapsed; specify 1 and the first level items in the outline will be expanded and so on.
Default is 0. Valid range is 0 to 9.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Rendering.PdfOptions.BookmarksOutlineLevel
member.summary: Specifies the level in the PDF document outline at which to display Word bookmarks.

remarks.para: Specify 0 and Word bookmarks will not be displayed in the PDF document outline. Specify 1 and Word bookmarks will be displayed in the PDF document outline at level 1; 2 for level 2 and so on.
Default is 0. Valid range is 0 to 9.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Rendering.PdfOptions.TextCompression
member.summary: Specifies compression type to be used for all textual content in the document.

remarks.para: Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Rendering.PdfOptions.IsEmbedTrueTypeFontsForAsciiChars
member.summary: True to embed true type fonts for ASCII characters 32-127. Fonts for character codes greater than 127 are always embedded. Default is true.

remarks.para: Setting this property to false can reduce the size of the PDF file, but the document might appear different when viewed on another computer if the same fonts are not installed. The document will still be readable because only US English characters will not be embedded in the PDF file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Rendering.PdfOptions.Compliance
member.summary: Specifies the PDF standards compliance level for output documents.

remarks.para: Default is .

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Tables.Cell
member.summary: Represents a table cell.

remarks.p: Cell can only be a child of a Row.
Cell can contain block-level nodes Paragraph and Table.
A minimal valid cell needs to have at least one Paragraph.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Tables.Cell.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Cell class.

remarks.p: When Cell is created, it belongs to the specified document, but is not yet part of the document and ParentNode is null.
To append Cell to the document use InsertAfter or InsertBefore on the row where you want the cell inserted.

member.param: The owner document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Tables.Cell.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the node.

remarks.p: This method serves as a copy constructor for nodes. The cloned node has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original node.
This method always performs a deep copy of the node. The isCloneChildren parameter specifies whether to perform copy all child nodes as well.

member.param: True to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself.
member.returns: The cloned node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Tables.Cell.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on DocumentVisitor.
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if DocumentVisitor stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.
member.remarks: Calls DocumentVisitor.VisitCellStart, then calls Accept for all child nodes of the section and calls DocumentVisitor.VisitCellEnd at the end.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField
member.summary: Represents a single form field.

remarks.p: Microsoft Word provides the following form fields: checkbox, text input and dropdown (combobox).
FormField is an inline-node and can only be a child of Paragraph.
FormField is represented in a document by a special character and positioned as a character within a line of text.

A complete form field in a Word document is a complex structure represented by several nodes: field start, field code such as FORMTEXT, form field data, field separator, field result, field end and a bookmark. To programmatically create form fields in a Word document use DocumentBuilder.InsertCheckBox, DocumentBuilder.InsertTextInput and DocumentBuilder.InsertComboBox which make sure all of the form field nodes are created in a correct order and in a suitable state.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.SpecialChar
member.summary: Base class for special characters in the document.

remarks.p: A Microsoft Word document can include a number of special characters that represent fields, form fields, shapes, OLE objects, footnotes etc. For the list of special characters see .
SpecialChar is an inline-node and can only be a child of Paragraph.

SpecialChar char is used as a base class for more specific classes that represent special characters that Aspose.Words provides programmatic access for. The SpecialChar class is also used itself to represent special character for which Aspose.Words does not provide detailed programmatic access.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Inline

remarks.p: A class derived from Inline can be a child of Paragraph.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.NodeType
member.summary: Returns NodeType.FormField.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the form field name.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.Type
member.summary: Returns the form field type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.Result
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that represents the result of this form field.

remarks.p: For a text form field the result is the text that is in the field.
For a checkbox form field the result can be "1" or "0" to indicate checked or unchecked.
For a dropdown form field the result is the string selected in the dropdown.
Note that setting Result for a text form field does not apply formatting specified in . If you want to set a value and apply the formatting, use the .

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.StatusText
member.summary: Returns or sets the text that's displayed in the status bar when a form field has the focus.

remarks.p: If the OwnStatus property is set to true, the StatusText property specifies the status bar text. If the OwnStatus property is set to false, the StatusText property specifies the name of an AutoText entry that contains status bar text for the form field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.OwnStatus
member.summary: Specifies the source of the text that's displayed in the status bar when a form field has the focus.

remarks.p: If true, the text specified by the StatusText property is displayed. If false, the text of the AutoText entry specified by the StatusText property is displayed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.HelpText
member.summary: Returns or sets the text that's displayed in a message box when the form field has the focus and the user presses F1.

remarks.p: If the OwnHelp property is set to True, HelpText specifies the text string value. If OwnHelp is set to False, HelpText specifies the name of an AutoText entry that contains help text for the form field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.OwnHelp
member.summary: Specifies the source of the text that's displayed in a message box when a form field has the focus and the user presses F1.

remarks.p: If True, the text specified by the HelpText property is displayed. If False, the text in the AutoText entry specified by the HelpText property is displayed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.CalculateOnExit
member.summary: True if references to the specified form field are automatically updated whenever the field is exited.

remarks.p: Setting CalculateOnExit only affects the behavior of the form field when the document is opened in Microsoft Word. Aspose.Words never updates references to the form field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.EntryMacro
member.summary: Returns or sets an entry macro name for the form field.
member.remarks: The entry macro runs when the form field gets the focus in Microsoft Word.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.ExitMacro
member.summary: Returns or sets an exit macro name for the form field.

remarks.p: The exit macro runs when the form field loses the focus in Microsoft Word.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.Enabled
member.summary: True if a form field is enabled.

remarks.p: If a form field is enabled, its contents can be changed as the form is filled in.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.TextInputFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets the text formatting for a text form field.

remarks.p: If the text form field contains regular text, then valid format strings are "", "UPPERCASE", "LOWERCASE", "FIRST CAPITAL" and "TITLE CASE". The strings are case-insensitive.
If the text form field contains a number or a date/time value, then valid format strings are number or date and time format strings.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.TextInputType
member.summary: Returns or sets the type of a text form field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.MaxLength
member.summary: Maximum length for the text field. Zero when the length is not limited.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.DropDownItems
member.summary: Provides access to the items of a dropdown form field.

remarks.p: Microsoft Word allows maximum 25 items in a dropdown form field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Fields.FormField.DropDownSelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index specifying the currently selected item in a dropdown form field.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Tables.Table
member.summary: Represents a table in a Word document.

remarks.p: Table is a block-level node and can be a child of classes derived from Story or InlineStory.
Table can contain one or more Row nodes.
A minimal valid table needs to have at least one Row.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Tables.Table.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Table class.

remarks.p: When Table is created, it belongs to the specified document, but is not yet part of the document and ParentNode is null.
To append Table to the document use InsertAfter or InsertBefore on the story where you want the table inserted.

member.param: The owner document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Tables.Table.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the node.

remarks.p: This method serves as a copy constructor for nodes. The cloned node has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original node.
This method always performs a deep copy of the node. The isCloneChildren parameter specifies whether to perform copy all child nodes as well.

member.param: True to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself.
member.returns: The cloned node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Tables.Table.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on DocumentVisitor.
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of nodes of a specific type.

remarks.p: NodeCollection does not own the nodes it contains, rather, is just a selection of nodes of the specified type, but the nodes are stored in the tree under their respective parent nodes.
NodeCollection supports indexed access, iteration and provides add and remove methods.

The NodeCollection collection can be "live" or "snapshot". When the collection is live, changes to the children of the node object that it was created from are immediately reflected in the nodes returned by the NodeCollection properties and methods.
NodeCollection is returned by and also serves as a base class for typed node collections such as , etc.
NodeCollection can be "flat" and contain only immediate children of the node it was created from, or it can be "deep" and contain all descendant children.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.INodeCollection
member.summary: Base interface for node collections. Reserved for internal use.
member.dev: Why it has to be public? So the obfuscator does not obfuscate the methods?

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.INodeCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets the enumerator for the collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.INodeCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.INodeCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the item at the specified index.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.Add(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Adds a node to the end of the collection.

remarks.p: The node is inserted as a child into the node object from which the collection was created.
If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The node to be added to the end of the collection.
member.exception: The NodeCollection is a "deep" collection.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.Insert(System.Int32,Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Inserts a node into the collection at the specified index.

remarks.p: The node is inserted as a child into the node object from which the collection was created.
If the index is equal to or greater than Count, the node is added at the end of the collection.
If the index is negative and its absolute value is greater than Count, the node is added at the end of the collection.
If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the node being inserted was created from another document, you should use to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be inserted into the current document.

member.param: The zero-based index of the node. Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the list. For example -1 means the last node, -2 means the second before last and so on.
The node to insert.
member.exception: The NodeCollection is a "deep" collection.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.Remove(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Removes the node from the collection and from the document.
member.param: The node to remove.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the node at the specified index from the collection and from the document.
member.param: The zero-based index of the node. Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the list. For example -1 means the last node, -2 means the second before last and so on.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.Clear
member.summary: Removes all nodes from this collection and from the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.Contains(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Determines whether a node is in the collection.

remarks.p: This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to Count.

member.param: The node to locate.
member.returns: True if item is found in the collection; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.IndexOf(Aspose.Words.Node)
member.summary: Returns the zero-based index of the specified node.
member.param: The node to locate.
member.returns: The zero-based index of the node within the collection, if found; otherwise, -1.

remarks.p: This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to Count.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.ToArray
member.summary: Copies all nodes from the collection to a new array of nodes.

remarks.p: You should not be adding/removing nodes while iterating over a collection of nodes because it invalidates the iterator and requires refreshes for live collections.
To be able to add/remove nodes during iteration, use this method to copy nodes into a fixed-size array and then iterate over the array.

member.returns: An array of nodes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Provides a simple "foreach" style iteration over the collection of nodes.
member.returns: An IEnumerator.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a node at the given index.
member.param: An index into the collection of nodes.

remarks.p: The index is zero-based.
Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the collection. For example -1 means the last item, -2 means the second before last and so on.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.
If index is negative and its absolute value is greater than the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.NodeCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of nodes in the collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Tables.CellCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a Cell at the given index.

remarks.p: The index is zero-based.
Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the collection. For example -1 means the last item, -2 means the second before last and so on.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.
If index is negative and its absolute value is greater than the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.

member.param: An index into the collection.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection
member.summary: A collection of objects that represent all the columns of text in a section of a document.

remarks.p: Use to set the number of text columns.
To make all columns equal width and spaced evenly, set to true and specify the amount of space between the columns in . MS Word will automatically calculate column widths.
If you have EvenlySpaced set to false, you need to specify width and spacing for each column individually. Use the indexer to access individual objects.
When using custom column widths, make sure the sum of all column widths and spacings between them equals page width minus left and right page margins.

member.dev: This is a pure presentation class. Does not store any model data, just provides friendly access to section attributes that are related to managing text columns.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.SetCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Arranges text into the specified number of text columns.

remarks.p: When is false and you increase the number of columns, new objects are created with zero width and spacing. You need to set width and spacing for the new columns.

member.param: The number of columns the text is to be arranged into.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.EvenlySpaced
member.summary: True if text columns are of equal width and evenly spaced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.Spacing
member.summary: When columns are evenly spaced, gets or sets the amount of space between each column in points.
member.remarks: Has effect only when is set to true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.Width
member.summary: When columns are evenly spaced, gets the width of the columns.

remarks.p: Has effect only when is set to true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.LineBetween
member.summary: When true, adds a vertical line between columns.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of columns in the section of a document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.TextColumnCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a text column at the specified index.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Section
member.summary: Represents a single section in a document.

remarks.p: Section can have one and maximum one of each . Body and HeaderFooter nodes can be in any order inside Section.
A minimal valid section needs to have Body with one Paragraph.
Each section has its own set of properties that specify page size, orientation, margins etc.
You can create a copy of a section using . The copy can be inserted into the same or different document.
To add, insert or remove a whole section including section break and section properties use methods of the Sections object.
To copy and insert just content of the section excluding the section break and section properties use AppendContent and PrependContent methods.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Section.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Section class.

remarks.p: When the section is created, it belongs to the specified document, but is not yet part of the document and ParentNode is null.
To include Section into a document use Document.InsertAfter, Document.InsertBefore or Sections.Add and Section.Insert methods.

member.param: The owner document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Section.Clone
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of this section.
member.dev: Kept to remain compatiable with the old API.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Section.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the node.

remarks.p: This method serves as a copy constructor for nodes. The cloned node has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original node.
This method always performs a deep copy of the node. The isCloneChildren parameter specifies whether to perform copy all child nodes as well.

member.param: True to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself.
member.returns: The cloned node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Section.Accept(Aspose.Words.DocumentVisitor)
member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

remarks.p: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on DocumentVisitor.
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.param: The visitor that will visit the nodes.
member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if DocumentVisitor stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.
member.remarks: Calls DocumentVisitor.VisitSectionStart, then calls Accept for all child nodes of the section and calls DocumentVisitor.VisitSectionEnd at the end.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Section.PrependContent(Aspose.Words.Section)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of content of the source section at the beginning of this section.

remarks.p: Only content of of the source section is copied, page setup, headers and footers are not copied.
The nodes are automatically imported if the source section belongs to a different document.
No new section is created in the destination document.

member.param: The section to copy content from.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Section.AppendContent(Aspose.Words.Section)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of content of the source section at the end of this section.

remarks.p: Only content of of the source section is copied, page setup, headers and footers are not copied.
The nodes are automatically imported if the source section belongs to a different document.
No new section is created in the destination document.

member.param: The section to copy content from.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Section.ClearContent
member.summary: Clears the section.

remarks.p: The text of is cleared, only one empty paragraph is left that represents the section break.
The text of all headers and footers is cleared, but objects themselves are not removed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Section.ClearHeadersFooters
member.summary: Clears the headers and footers of this section.

remarks.p: The text of all headers and footers is cleared, but objects themselves are not removed.
This makes headers and footers of this section linked to headers and footers of the previous section.

member.summary: Represents a start of a Word field in a document.

can only be a child of .

A complete field in a Microsoft Word document is a complex structure consisting of a field start character, field code, field separator character, field result and field end character. Some fields only have field start, field code and field end.
To easily insert a new field into a document, use the method.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Drawing namespace contains classes that allow to create and modify drawing objects in Microsoft Word documents.
Aspose.Words supports all grawing objects in Microsoft Word documents, including OfficeArt shapes, textboxes, pictures, diagrams, OLE objects and ActiveX controls.
The main classes in this namespace are:

list.item: represents an object in the drawing layer, such as an AutoShape, textbox, freeform, OLE object, ActiveX control, or picture.
represents a group of shapes in a document.
is the base class for the shape and group shape classes, provides all common shape properties such as position, size and text wrapping. A shape is a node in the document tree.

summary.p: Although not every type of drawing object can be programmatically created and not every shape property can be accessed, all drawing objects are fully preserved in Microsoft Word documents during document open-save operations.
Names of classes, methods and properties in this namespace correspond to VML DOM where possible.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData
member.summary: Defines an image for a shape.

remarks.p: Use the property to access and modify the image inside a shape. You do not create instances of the class directly.
An image can be stored inside a shape, linked to external file or both (linked and stored in the document).

Regardless of whether the image is stored inside the shape or linked, you can always access the actual image using the , and methods. If the image is stored inside the shape, you can also directly access it using the property.
To store an image inside a shape use the method. To link an image to a shape, set the property.

It is the responsibility of the caller to dispose the image object.

member.summary: Creates and returns a stream that contains the image bytes.

remarks.p: If the image bytes are stored in the shape, creates and returns a object.
If the image is linked and stored in a file, opens the file and returns a object.
If the image is linked and stored in an external URL, downloads the file and returns a object.
Is it the responsibility of the caller to dispose the stream object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.CropTop
member.summary: Defines the fraction of picture removal from the top side.

remarks.p: The amount of cropping can range from -1.0 to 1.0. The default value is 0. Note that a value of 1 will display no picture at all. Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). Positive values less than 1 will result in the remaining picture being stretched to fit the shape.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Drawing.ImageData.CropBottom
member.summary: Defines the fraction of picture removal from the bottom side.

remarks.p: The amount of cropping can range from -1.0 to 1.0. The default value is 0. Note that a value of 1 will display no picture at all. Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). Positive values less than 1 will result in the remaining picture being stretched to fit the shape.
The default value is 0.

remarks.p: The amount of cropping can range from -1.0 to 1.0. The default value is 0. Note that a value of 1 will display no picture at all. Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). Positive values less than 1 will result in the remaining picture being stretched to fit the shape.

Negative values will result in the picture being squeezed inward from the edge being cropped (the empty space between the picture and the cropped edge will be filled by the fill color of the shape). member.name: T:Aspose.Words.BuildingBlocks.GlossaryDocument
member.summary: Represents the root element for a glossary document within a Word document. A glossary document is a storage for AutoText, AutoCorrect entries and Building Blocks.

remarks.para: Some documents, usually templates, can contain AutoText, AutoCorrect entries and/or Building Blocks (also known as glossary document entries, document parts or building blocks).
To access building blocks, you need to load a document into a object. Building blocks will be available via the property.
can contain any number of objects. Each represents one document part.
Corresponds to the glossaryDocument and docParts elements in OOXML.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.DocumentBase
member.summary: Provides the abstract base class for a main document and a glossary document of a Word document.

remarks.para: Aspose.Words represents a Word document as a tree of nodes. is a root node of the tree that contains all other nodes of the document.
also stores document-wide information such as and that the tree nodes might refer to.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBase.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the document.

remarks.p: If you need to generate many documents from a single document, just load the document into memory once, clone it and populate the cloned document with your data. This speeds up generation of documents because there is no need to load and parse the document from file every time.

member.param: True to recursively clone the content of the document; false to clone only the document node and document-wide objects such as styles and lists.
member.returns: The cloned document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBase.ImportNode(Aspose.Words.Node,System.Boolean)
member.overloads: Imports a node from another document to the current document.

summary.p: Imports a node from another document to the current document.

remarks.p: This method uses the option to resolve formatting.
Importing a node creates a copy of the source node belonging to the importing document. The returned node has no parent. The source node is not altered or removed from the original document.

Before a node from another document can be inserted into this document, it must be imported. During import, document-specific properties such as references to styles and lists are translated from the original to the importing document. After the node was imported, it can be inserted into the appropriate place in the document using or .
If the source node already belongs to the destination document, then simply a deep clone of the source node is created.

member.param: The node being imported.
True to import all child nodes recursively; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The cloned node that belongs to the current document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.DocumentBase.ImportNode(Aspose.Words.Node,System.Boolean,Aspose.Words.ImportFormatMode)

summary.p: Imports a node from another document to the current document with an option to control formatting.

remarks.p: This overload is useful to control how styles and list formatting are imported.
Importing a node creates a copy of the source node belonging to the importing document. The returned node has no parent. The source node is not altered or removed from the original document.

Before a node from another document can be inserted into this document, it must be imported. During import, document-specific properties such as references to styles and lists are translated from the original to the importing document. After the node was imported, it can be inserted into the appropriate place in the document using or .
If the source node already belongs to the destination document, then simply a deep clone of the source node is created.

member.param: The node to imported.
True to import all child nodes recursively; otherwise, false.
Specifies how to merge style formatting that clashes.
member.returns: The cloned, imported node. The node belongs to the destination document, but has no parent.

member.summary: Accepts a visitor.

For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

member.returns: True if all nodes were visited; false if DocumentVisitor stopped the operation before visiting all nodes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.BuildingBlocks.GlossaryDocument.GetBuildingBlock(Aspose.Words.BuildingBlocks.BuildingBlockGallery,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Finds a building block using the specified gallery, category and name.

remarks.para: This is a convenience method that iterates over all building blocks in this collection and returns the first building block that matches the specified gallery, category and name.

Microsoft Word organizes building blocks into galleries. The galleries are predefined using the enum. Within each gallery, building blocks can be organized into one or more categories. The category name is a string. Each building block has a name. A building block name is not guaranteed to be unique.

member.param: The gallery criteria.
The category criteria.
The building block name criteria.
member.returns: The matching building block or null if a match was not found.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.NodeImporter
member.summary: Allows to efficiently perform repeated import of nodes from one document to another.

remarks.p: Aspose.Words provides functionality for easy copying and moving fragments between Microsoft Word documents. This is known as "importing nodes". Before you can insert a fragment from one document into another, you need to "import" it. Importing creates a deep clone of the original node, ready to be inserted into the destination document.
The simplest way to import a node is to use the method provided by the object.

However, when you need to import nodes from one document to another multiple times, it is better to use the class. The class allows to minimize the number of styles and lists created in the destination document.

Copying or moving fragments from one Microsoft Word document to another presents a number of technical challenges for Aspose.Words. In a Word document, styles and list formatting are stored centrally, separately from the text of the document. The paragraphs and runs of text merely reference the styles by internal unique identifiers.

The challenges arise from the fact that styles and lists are different in different documents. For example, to copy a paragraph formatted with the Heading 1 style from one document to another, a number of things must be taken into account: decide whether to copy the Heading 1 style from the source document to the destination document, clone the paragraph, update the cloned paragraph so it refers to the correct Heading 1 style in the destination document. If the style had to be copied, all the styles that it references (based on style and next paragraph style) should be analyzed and possibly copied too and so on. Similar issues exist when copying bulleted or numbered paragraphs because Microsoft Word stores list definitions separately from text.
The class is like a context, that holds the "translation tables" during the import. It correctly translates between styles and lists in the source and destination documents.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeImporter.#ctor(Aspose.Words.DocumentBase,Aspose.Words.DocumentBase,Aspose.Words.ImportFormatMode)
member.summary: Initalizes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The source document.
The destination document that will be the owner of imported nodes.
Specifies how to merge style formatting that clashes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeImporter.ImportNode(Aspose.Words.Node,System.Boolean)

summary.p: Imports a node from one document into another.

remarks.p: Importing a node creates a copy of the source node belonging to the importing document. The returned node has no parent. The source node is not altered or removed from the original document.

Before a node from another document can be inserted into this document, it must be imported. During import, document-specific properties such as references to styles and lists are translated from the original to the importing document. After the node was imported, it can be inserted into the appropriate place in the document using or .
If the source node already belongs to the destination document, then simply a deep clone of the source node is created.

member.param: The node to import.
True to import all child nodes recursively; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The cloned, imported node. The node belongs to the destination document, but has no parent.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.SectionCollection
member.summary: A collection of Section objects in the document.

remarks.p: A Microsoft Word document can contain multiple sections. To create a section in a Microsoft Word, select the Insert/Break command and select a break type. The break specifies whether section starts on a new page or on the same page.

Programmatically inserting and removing sections can be used to customize documents produced during mail merge. If a document needs to have different content or parts of the content depending on some criteria, then you can create a "master" document that contains multiple sections and delete some of the sections before or after mail merge.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.SectionCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a section at the given index.

remarks.p: The index is zero-based.
Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the collection. For example -1 means the last item, -2 means the second before last and so on.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.
If index is negative and its absolute value is greater than the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.

member.param: An index into the list of sections.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Reporting.MergeImageFieldEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event.

remarks.p: This event occurs during mail merge when an image mail merge field is encountered in the document. You can respond to this event to return a file name, stream, or an object to the mail merge engine so it is inserted into the document.
There are three properties avaialable , and to specify where the image must be taken from. Set only one of these properties.
To insert an image mail merge field into a document in Word, select Insert/Field command, then select MergeField and type Image:MyFieldName.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Reporting.MergeImageFieldEventArgs.ImageFileName
member.summary: Sets the file name of the image that the mail merge engine must insert into the document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Reporting.MergeImageFieldEventArgs.ImageStream
member.summary: Specifies the stream for the mail merge engine to read an image from.

remarks.p: Aspose.Words closes this stream after it merges the image into the document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.Reporting.MergeImageFieldEventArgs.Image

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.NodeList
member.summary: Represents a collection of nodes.

remarks.p: NodeList is returned by and contains a collection of nodes matching the XPath query.
NodeList supports indexed access and iteration.
remarks.note: Treat the NodeList collection as a "snapshot" collection. NodeList starts as a "live" collection because the nodes are not actually retrieved when the XPath query is run. The nodes are only retrieved upon access and at this time the node and all nodes that precede it are cached forming a "snapshot" collection.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeList.ToArray
member.summary: Copies all nodes from the collection to a new array of nodes.

remarks.p: You should not be adding/removing nodes while iterating over a collection of nodes because it invalidates the iterator and requires refreshes for live collections.
To be able to add/remove nodes during iteration, use this method to copy nodes into a fixed-size array and then iterate over the array.

member.returns: An array of nodes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.NodeList.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Provides a simple "foreach" style iteration over the collection of nodes.
member.returns: An IEnumerator.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.NodeList.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a node at the given index.

remarks.p: The index is zero-based.
Negative indexes are allowed and indicate access from the back of the collection. For example -1 means the last item, -2 means the second before last and so on.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.
If index is negative and its absolute value is greater than the number of items in the list, this returns a null reference.

member.param: An index into the list of nodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Words.NodeList.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of nodes in the list.

remarks.p: Cells can only be merged vertically if their left and right boundaries are identical.

When cells are vertically merged, the display areas of the merged cells are consolidated. The consolidated area is used to display the contents of the first vertically merged cell and all other vertically merged cells must be empty.

summary.p: The Aspose.Words.Reporting namespace contains classes that form the reporting engine of Aspose.Words. The reporting engine allows to quickly and easily populate documents designed in Microsoft Word with data from various data sources such as DataTable, DataSet, DataView, IDataReader or an array of values.
The object which provides access to the reporting functionality is available via the Document.MailMerge property.

member.name: T:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListCollection
member.summary: Stores and manages formatting of bulleted and numbered lists used in a document.

remarks.p: A list in a Microsoft Word document is a set of list formatting properties. The formatting of the lists is stored in the collection separately from the paragraphs of text.
You do not create objects of this class. There is always only one object per document and it is accessible via the property.
To create a new list based on a predefined list template or based on a list style, use the method.
To create a new list with formatting identical to an existing list, use the method.
To make a paragraph bulleted or numbered, you need to apply list formatting to a paragraph by assigning a object to the property of .
To remove list formatting from a paragraph, use the method.

If you know a bit about WordprocessingML, then you might know it defines separate concepts for "list" and "list definition". This exactly corresponds to how list formatting is stored in a Microsoft Word document at the low level. List definition is like a "schema" and list is like an instance of a list definition.

To simplify programming model, Aspose.Words hides the distinction between list and list definition in much the same way like Microsoft Word hides this in its user interface. This allows you to concentrate more on how you want your document to look like, rather than building low-level objects to satisfy requirements of the Microsoft Word file format.
It is not possible to delete lists once they are created in the current version of Aspose.Words. This is similar to Microsoft Word where user does not have explicit control over list definitions.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets the enumerator object that will enumerate lists in the document.

member.overloads: Creates a new list and adds it to the collection of lists in the document.
member.summary: Creates a new list based on a predefined template and adds it to the collection of lists in the document.
member.param: The template of the list.
member.returns: The newly created list.

remarks.p: Aspose.Words list templates correspond to the 21 list templates available in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word 2003.
All lists created using this method have 9 list levels.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListCollection.Add(Aspose.Words.Style)
member.summary: Creates a new list that references a list style and adds it to the collection of lists in the document.
member.param: The list style.
member.returns: Thew newly created list.

remarks.p: The newly created list references the list style. If you change the properties of the list style, it is reflected in the properties of the list. Vice versa, if you change the properties of the list, it is reflected in the properties of the list style.

member.name: M:Aspose.Words.Lists.ListCollection.AddCopy(Aspose.Words.Lists.List)
member.summary: Creates a new list by copying the specified list and adding it to the collection of lists in the document.
member.param: The source list to copy from.
member.returns: The newly created list.

remarks.p: The source list can be from any document. If the source list belongs to a different document, a copy of the list is created and added to the current document.
If the source list is a reference to or a definition of a list style, the newly created list is not related to the original list style.

member.param: The list identifier.
member.returns: Returns the list object. Returns null if a list with the specified identifier was not found.

remarks.p: You don't normally need to use this method. Most of the time you apply list formatting to paragraphs just by settings the property of the object.
